text: hi my name is mike coleman i'm a
developer advocate on the light sale
team here at amazon web services
and today i'm going to take you through
a video that shows you some of the
capabilities of amazon light sale
but before we get started i just wanted
to let you know that you don't have to
try to do
everything at the same time that i'm
doing it on the screen we've got a
written
guide in the description below that you
can go and download and then after the
video
you can go try it all on your own so
let's get started
in this video we're going to look at how
you can create a linux virtual machine
on amazon light sale we're here on the
lightsail homepage and we're going to
get started by clicking create instance
the first decision we need to make is
where do we want to run our instance so
we'll click on the link here
and you can see we have regions all over
the globe pick a region that's close to
where you or your customers are
i'm in oregon so i'm going to leave that
default selected
we'll scroll down we can also pick an
availability zone availability zones or
fault tolerance zones
not really important for this example so
we'll leave it at the default
next we'll scroll down and choose our
operating system so we'll click on os
only
and then we're going to go ahead and
just run amazon linux so we'll leave
that selected
now we'll move into some optional
components i'm going to click on launch
script
a launch script is a script that runs
the very first time an instance is
booted
so if i wanted to update all the
packages that were already installed on
my system
i could paste that command here into the
box and the very first time the system
runs
the yum command will update all of my
installed packages
the next option we have is what to do
with our ssh keys now by default we
create an ssh key for you
so if we click on this here you can go
in and you can see that you can upload
your own
or you can use the default you can
generate a new one
again just going to stick with the
default and the last thing we're going
to do is we're going to enable automatic
backups so by clicking snapshots i can
choose a time of day
that i want the system to back itself up
and we'll store those backups for about
seven days
to help protect against any sort of data
loss or failure
so next let's choose how big of an
instance we want
now instances are priced based on the
amount of cpu
ram disk and network throughput and they
range from three dollars and fifty cents
up to 160 dollars
we're going to go ahead and use the 3.50
instance
so i'll leave that one selected
and then we'll scroll down and we're
going to go ahead and give ourselves
a name here so we'll call this linux
instance
then finally we have the option of
adding a tag
to our instance so we can easily find it
or organize resources later so we're
going to go ahead and use a key value
tag and what we're going to do is
set a key of os for operating system and
then we're going to set the value at
linux
so later i'll be able to go back and say
well why don't you show me all of my
instances that are running linux
by choosing the key value pair of os and
linux
so let's click create instance the
instance will go off and
start the creation process and we'll
rejoin it when it's back up and running
so the instance is now running so if i
click this connection icon right here
that's going to let me start an ssh
session
into my linux instance so you can see
here we get the linux command line and
from here i can do anything that i would
do on any other linux box
you know install my software adjust
system settings and go from there
so that's all it takes to get a linux
instance running on amazon light sale
